1.name: Webbed Entrance
desc: "     Sticky, sticky, sticky!  The ground is cluttered with leaves, decayed
remains of webbed crickets, beetle, rats, dogs (?), and even humans.
You begin to wonder about what lies ahead.  The air is damp here,
and even the little light that shines through the canopy seems
absorbed into the webbing.

2.name: Webby Passage
desc: "     You find that footing here is very good, almost too good.  The
limbs are coated with cobwebs and seem unusually strong for tree
branches.  Paths lead in four directions.  The eastward path goes
down a bit.

3.name: Wasp Hive
desc: "     Drones scuttle about in this room.  The cells on the walls
are honeycomb in shape and many of the maggots and wasps you see
have fang-marks on there bodies.  You sense some order in their markings.

4.name: Webby Passage
desc: "     Another webby passage, all sticky and wet.  Tiny ballooning
spiders fill the air.  It seems that these young ones are newborns.

5.name: Beneath the Busy Path
desc: "     You here the sounds of crawling arachnids above.  The rhythms of
the footsteps suggest a primitive order in there movement.  The light
seems brighter upwards.

6.name: On the Busy Path
desc: "     Spiders, spiders, everywhere!  It is almost ant-like in efficiency
with one big difference.  The spiders here are carrying ant-corpses,
as well as rats, wolves, and humans.

7.name: On the Busy Path
desc: "     Spiders, spiders, everywhere!  It is almost ant-like in efficiency
with one big difference.  The spiders here are carrying ant-corpses,
as well as cats, wolves, and humans.

8.name: On the Busy Path
desc: "     Spiders, spiders, everywhere!  It is almost ant-like in efficiency
with one big difference.  The spiders here are carrying ant-corpses,
as well as cats, dogs, and humans.

9.name: A Split in the Path
desc: "     As always, there is a split in the road.  One road is strewn
with cricket feelers.  The other is well-kept and suitable for smooth
travelling.  The webbing that was prevalent in earlier rooms is almost
non-existant now.

10.name: Fuzzy Tree Limb
desc: "     You are on a "fuzzy" tree limb.  Interesting, since the branches
seem to have "hairs" sprouting from its bark.  As you look
closer you see millions of aphids covering each limb.

11.name: Tree Trunk
desc: "     You feel that you can rest here safely.  There is evidence of
webbing here, but it is of a finer quality.

12.name: Tree Lair Entrance
desc: "     It seems the inhabitant of this place does not web her
victims, as evidenced by the remains before you.  The area
is cluttered with desiccated corpses, apparently bitten
but unwebbed, and drained of their life juices.

13.name: Wolf Spider Lair
desc: "     Very dark, as all lairs of spiders are.  Not much of furnishings
save an exit.  The wolf spider keeps no corpses here, but rather
throws them out at her leisure.

20.name: The Webless Path
desc: "     Strange.  No webbing here.  In fact, no sounds whatsoever.
The path continues northward, where you find that you may have to
tightrope your way across a ravine.

21.name: Above the Ravine
desc: "     Stranger still.  Your feet get a real firm grip on the spiderline.
You are above a deep ravine.  This line connects you between two trees.
Below you can see a prismatic web with lots of animal bones caught in it:
some bear and small deer bones in fact.  No human skeletons are visible
(yet).

22.name: The Rainbow Web
desc: "     This is the rainbow web--each strand, each link, a hue of violently
sharp colors and contrasts.  The resident here seems to have a command
of light as well.

23.name: The Web Forest
desc: "     The trees here take on a different appearance--they are not trees
anymore, but disjointed make-shift silken made shafts, sticky to the touch,
and webby in texture.  This is another world it would appear.

24.name: The Slave Pit
desc: "     You have entered the slave pit.  A voice blares in the distance,
"Get back to work, maggots!"  Rails upon rails of mined gold and silver
clutter the trail beneath you.

25.name: The Tether Path
desc: You find yourself on another tethered path, finer in quality than the others.
You can see the path increases in quality as it leads off to the east and the
west. To north an eerie darkness descends blanketing what appears to be some
kind of a building in a dark gloom.

26.name: A Road Crossing
26.desc: "     Another shifty little strand of webs, almost ethereal in nature.

27.name: A Leader Strand
desc: "     This strand is weightier, more sturdy.  It shimmers as you step on
it.  You are definitely not in the Midgaardian realms anymore.  Just
where you are you can't tell.  It feels like you're moving through
ether.  You can still get back down to more surer lands.

28.name: The Entrance of the Ethereal Web
desc: "     You are at the entrance to ethereal web.  Flickering in and out,
in and out, each strand reveals a different hue from black to green
to blue.

30.name: The Young Wormkin's Crib
desc: "     A playpen of sorts, with maggots of wasps and other baby vermin
lying about.  You feel that humans have been played with here too,
and eaten later.  You sense that the maker of this place has
an appetite for dragon meat, and uses this room as a breeding
area.

31.name: The Base of the Web
desc: "     Large strands connect at this point.  The node shimmers and
flickers within the ether.  You see many flying creatures--
insects, pegasi, and dragon wormkins--navigate the dangerous
passages of the web.  Exits go in many directions.

32.name: Through the Trees
desc: "     This part of the web intersects through the branches of some
trees.  Various leaves and other debris that the many drones
have not picked up yet lie here.

33.name: Above the Clouds
desc: "     You can see all of Midgaard in this ethereal web.  Many
of the larger dragons that do wish to fly seem to fly
away from the sticky strands of the web.

34.name: On A Cloud
desc: "     Rather thick in consistency.  You realize this is not
a typical cloud, but it might be the nest of an aerial creature.

35.name: A Link in the Ethereal Web
desc: "     This is another link in the ethereal web.  Various creatures
seem to get caught (or hypnotized) by its sticky strands.

36.name: The Tenuous Strand
desc: "     Very windy here since it goes up into the sky somewhat.
Still, it's safe enough to move around.

40.name: The Elder Wormkin's Room
desc: "     A more mature wormkin it seems resides here.  Various tomes of
arcane lore clutter the area, along with shards of armor and weaponry.

41.name: Another Tree Limb
desc: "     Once again the web crosses another tree limb.  To the side you
see the possible entrace to another creatures lair.

42.name: The Bird Spider's Lair
desc: "   This is a big game hunter among most spiders.  Crushed jewels
and other weapons suggest the inhabitant must have powerful jaws.
Beware!

45.name: A Link in the Ethereal Web
desc: "     This is another link in the ethereal web.  Various creatures
seem to get caught (or hypnotized) by its sticky strands.

46.name: The Quiet Tree Top
desc: "     Here is a quiet tree top.  Downwards you can see a familiar path
that may lead back to Midgaard.

47.name: On The Web
desc: "     RRRRRRRRRRROOOOOOOOOOOOOAAAAAAAAAAAAAARR!  You hear the roar
of a powerful beast.  Dragon, you think.  You shiver in your boots
as you tiptoe on this section of the web.

50.name: The Ki-Rin Chamber
desc: "     A wise ki-rin was entrapped here many years ago.  It is from her
that the ruler of this realm zaps his magical strength.

55.name: A Link in the Ethereal Web
desc: "     This is another link in the ethereal web.  Various creatures
seem to get caught (or hypnotized) by its sticky strands.  To
the north you sense the heavy breathing of a fiery animal.

60.name: Yevaud's Lair
desc: "     Yevaud, the Usurper of Midgaard, resides here.  A voice cries
out, "BEWARE, the Usurper of Midgaard lives here!  FLEE while you can!"
But even Yevaud has his master...or so you deduce.

65.name: A Link in the Ethereal Web
desc: "     This is another link in the ethereal web.  Various creatures
seem to get caught (or hypnotized) by its sticky strands.  A single
spider line lies to the north, while ghastly seemings are due
southward.  The grim entrance of Arachnos' Lair is downward.

66.name: Entrance to the Donjonkeep
desc: "     A dark path at the end of the web strand, you see ahead
a torch lit chamber where the souls of unavenged adventurers
come and gnash their teeth.  The howls and screams of many echo
through the hall ways.  You see one definite path ahead.

67.name: The Guardian's Room
desc: "     A chair sits here for a tireless guardian who ensures that no
soul escapes.  The room is undecorated.

extra.desc: An ordinary chair, well used, glued to the ground by spiderweb.

68.name: Realm of the Hopeless
desc: "     Here you see many misguided souls who think they still live.
They search for those who killed them without warrant, and seek the
free souls of living beings to inhabit and perhaps adventure once
more.

69.name: Realm of the Hopeless
desc: "     Here you see many misguided souls who think they still live.
They search for those who killed them without warrant, and seek the
free souls of living beings to inhabit and perhaps adventure once
more.

70.name: The Donjonkeep
desc: "     No souls have ever lived in this place.  The wails of slaves
and the howls of wolves are the only way you can describe the sounds
you hear.  The walls are thin and wispy.  The only light you recieve
is the shimmering from the strand of the ethereal web you used to get
here.

71.name: The Single Spider Line
desc: "     A single spider line supports you once more.  As you look
across the ether you seen a single shack up ahead with a light in
the window.  You sense a great evil coming from the north and feel
inclined to go back on the ethereal web and take your chances there.

72.name: The Single Spider Line
desc: "     A single spider line supports you once more.  The shack comes
closer into view and you are even more inclined to go back now.

73.name: The Hermit's Corner
desc: "     Here you see evidence of a vagrant's abode.  The shack is to the
north, if you dare enter it.  You get the sneaking feeling you should
go back now.  The skies above you darken and roar with the laughter
of thunder.

80.name: Mahatma's Inescapable Trap
desc: "     Mahatma, that silly thief, is here.  He says,
"Hmmm, you look like good good slave material!"
You hear some buzzing speech in an unintelligible
launguage and and then THUD on the back of your head.

extra.desc: suddenly a feeling of disorientation overcomes you...

81.name: Wasp Hive
desc: "     Drones scuttle about in this room.  The cells on the walls
are honeycomb in shape and many of the maggots and wasps you see
have fang-marks on there bodies.  You sense some order in their markings.

82.name: Wasp Hive
desc: "     Drones scuttle about in this room.  The cells on the walls
are honeycomb in shape and many of the maggots and wasps you see
have fang-marks on there bodies.  You sense some order in their markings.

83.name: Wasp Hive
desc: "     Drones scuttle about in this room.  The cells on the walls
are honeycomb in shape and many of the maggots and wasps you see
have fang-marks on there bodies.  You sense some order in their markings.

84.name: Wasp Hive
desc: "     Drones scuttle about in this room.  The cells on the walls
are honeycomb in shape and many of the maggots and wasps you see
have fang-marks on there bodies.  You sense some order in their markings.

85.name: Wasp Hive
desc: "     Drones scuttle about in this room.  The cells on the walls
are honeycomb in shape and many of the maggots and wasps you see
have fang-marks on there bodies.  You sense some order in their markings.

86.name: Wasp Hive
desc: "     Drones scuttle about in this room.  The cells on the walls
are honeycomb in shape and many of the maggots and wasps you see
have fang-marks on there bodies.  A scene is depicted on the wall and
some directional markings....

87.name: Wasp Hive
desc: "     Drones scuttle about in this room.  The cells on the walls
are honeycomb in shape and many of the maggots and wasps you see
have fang-marks on there bodies.  You sense some order in their markings.

88.name: Wasp Hive
desc: "     Drones scuttle about in this room.  The cells on the walls
are honeycomb in shape and many of the maggots and wasps you see
have fang-marks on there bodies.  You sense some order in their markings.

89.name: Wasp Hive
desc: "     Drones scuttle about in this room.  The cells on the walls
are honeycomb in shape and many of the maggots and wasps you see
have fang-marks on there bodies.  You sense some order in their markings.

90.name: The Entrance to the Arachnos' Lair
desc: "     All strands inevitably lead here, the center of the web, the
entrance to Arachnos' Lair.

91.name: The Sticky Chamber
desc: "     You can still bail out since your knees are shaking from the
anticipation (or is it fear?).  The sky is clear on this strand of
web, surprisingly unsticky.  The strand does not vibrate like the
others.  A few ballooning spiders pass by, cackling "You're gonna
die, you're gonna fry.  Good bye!

92.name: The Great Door
desc: "     Before you you see a large, web-like door.  Various designs
of ancient runes and names of Midgaard heroes are etched into
the webwork.  Perhaps lists of victims?  You can't tell.

99.name: The Lair of Arachnos
desc: "     This is the lair of the Empress Spider, Arachnos.  A lavishly
adorned rainbow web, her lair allows her to move to any universe
she wishes by using her magical strands to the Prime Material Plane.
Coffers upon coffers of gold, magical jewels and gems await.  Unfor-
tunately Arachnos is a baggy spider too, and webs all her treasures
to her beautiful silken body.

100.name: The Bog
desc: "     You awaken in a dark and humid bog.  The air is wet it would seem that
many travelers have not been here, and maybe those who have come across here
has paid with their life.  There is no trail.  The bog continues...

101.name: The Bog
desc: "     The bog is wet and suddenly a feeling of disorientation overcomes you.
It would seem that many travelers have not been here, and maybe those
who have come across here have paid with their life.  There is no trail.
The bog continues...

102.name: The Bog
desc: "     The bog is wet and you still feel disoriented.
It would seem that many travelers have not been here, and maybe those
who have come across here have paid with their life.  There is no trail.
The bog continues...

103.name: The Bog
desc: "     The bog is disgusting and and you feel like you are going to throw up.
It would seem that many travelers have not been here, and maybe those
who have come across here have paid with their life.  There is no trail.
The bog continues...

104.name: The Bog
desc: "     The bog is musty and you feel sick from the foul odor.
It would seem that many travelers have not been here, and maybe those
who have come across here have paid with their life.  There is no trail.
The bog continues...

105.name: The Bog
desc: "     The bog shimmers and you begin to feel sleepy.
It would seem that many travelers have not been here, and maybe those
who have come across here have paid with their life.
You spy a body bobbing out of the corner of the bog.
The remains of an adventurer floats in the corner of the bog.
Its flesh has been partially picked clean by the wasp larvae.
A skeletal hand still clutches a piece of paper with a message on it...
Our party is lost and they recalled.  It is a bummer that I did not
have a recall. Why haven't they come back for me???
Oh man! These wasps look hungry...
